timeline.bodyText: This could happen every request?  Creation of the reader is an expensive operation and should be moved to static initialization within a @recorder.  This will become more important if GCF ends up supporting a native binding.
timeline.author: patriot1burke

replies.bodyText:
In fact I'm asking myself if using Jackson is really the way to implement it. GCF uses Gson for this maybe I need also to use it.
What is a little tricky here is that instead of implementing the three function types (HttpFunction, BackgroundFunctin, RawBakgroundFunction), I only implements two by Quarkus (HttpFunction and RawBackgroundFunction) as BackgroundFunction is the same as RawBakgroundFunction with the input event deserialized to the type parameter. So I choose to limit code duplication to deserialize this type parameter myself instead of letting GCP doing it for me and providing only one implementation.
replies.author: loicmathieu

replies.bodyText: Is Funqy layered on top of this?  One thing to consider is that Funqy needs to be consistent across all cloud platform on what JSON marshalling layer it uses.  We can't use GSON for Funqy GCF and Jackson for Funqy Lambda.
replies.author: patriot1burke

replies.bodyText:
No, Funky uses it's own invoker.
I plan to refactor the three GCF functions extensions to share some code but not the marshalling layer.
replies.author: loicmathieu

replies.bodyText: @patriot1burke I choose to switch to Gson as it is what GCF does inside it's invoker so let's be consistent.
replies.author: loicmathieu
